result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. NATHANIEL I R BORST

records.addlTxt:
NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for NATHANIEL I R BORST.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states their is no agreement and requests a Jury Trial in 2022CF76. Statement by ADA McElroy, informs the Court that the defendant has another case scheduled for Initial Appearance next week. 2022CF76 - Court sets for Status Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 2:30 PM and all motions and witness lists to be filed the day before. Statement by ADA McElroy - revokes the offers in both cases. 2022CF71 - Court sets for Status Hearing on the same date and time.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for NATHANIEL I R BORST
Current: 533 4th Street Room #6, Algoma, WI 54201 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2022)
Prior: 323 S Washington St, Berlin, WI 54923
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:11 PM Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST appeared by phone.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for NATHANIEL I R BORST.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Defendant states he will waive the preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set both cases for Return Date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 2:13 PM
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

No Contact with the victim ARS or their residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is not to discuss this case with the co-defendant.                (bond filled out with wrong victim's initials)

No Contact with the victim ARF or their residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Def is not to discuss this case with the codefendant. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:13 AM Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for NATHANIEL I R BORST.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. 2022CF76-Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recomendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim ARF or their residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Def is not to discuss this case with the codefendant. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim on May 31, 2022 at 2:15 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:15 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:09 PM Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for NATHANIEL I R BORST.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the right to a prelim. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant on both counts.

Court notes defendant has another case, 21CF76. Defendant states he is applying for the public defender and is waiting to see who will represent him for this case.. Court sets 21CF76 for an adjourned initial on May 10 at 10:00 AM and 21CF71 for a status hearing. Mandatory Appearance.

Court adjourned at 1:14 PM.

Defendant called and stated he was sick and wanted an adjournment. Informed that defendant that he has an attorney on 22CF71 and needs to contact his attorney. Also informed the defendant that he needs to apply to the PD's office on this case 22CF76. NOTE: Defendant will appear via zoom - request of Atty Kapelis on 2022CF71.
